result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Shimeka L Currin was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Shimeka L Currin in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea hearing (Phase I of special plea).  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

PHASE I:

COUNTS 1 AND 2:  The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction STAYED pending completion of special plea proceedings.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Defense requests updated report, forensic unit contacted.  Defendant to report to Wisconsin Forensic Unit on 4-21-15 at 10:00 a.m.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott F Anderson in court, defendant Shimeka L Currin appears via video conference from Winnebago Health Institute.    Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Competency Hearing.  Defense challenging report dated 4-14-14 authored by Eric Driessen, Ph.D.  Parties stipulate as to qualifications of Dr. Driessen as an expert witness for this hearing.  On motion of the state, the Court takes judicial notice of aforementioned report.  Dr. Driessen appears telephonically due to relocation out of the state of Wisconsin.   Sworn for the state:  Dr. Eric Driessen.  The Court addresses the defendant and she believes she is competent to proceed.  Cross-examination of Dr. Driessen.   Argument given by the state and defense.  The Court finds that the state has met its burden by clear and convincing evidence that the defendant is incompetent at this time; additional findings and rulings set forth on the record.  Defense request for outpatient treatment argued and granted.  The Court orders the defendant to be evaluated for community based treatment (Outpatient Competency Restoration Program).  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.


  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

dated 3-7-14 authored by Robert Rawski, received and filed.

Defendant Shimeka L Currin in court with Attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Shimeka L Currin in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Competency hearing.  Parties in receipt of report dated 2-11-14 authored by Dr. Robert Rawski.  Defense indicates that based on off the record conference the parties held with Dr. Rawski competency hearing no longer necessary.  Parties stipulate to the report of Dr. Rawski.  The Defendant believes she is competent to proceed.  The state challenges the position of the defendant.  Competency hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Dr. Robert Rawski.  Parties stipulate to qualifications of this witness.  Testimony taken.  On motion of the state, the Court takes judicial notice of report of Dr. Rawski dated 2-11-14.  Parties stipulate to having the defendant reexamined.  The Court ordered second examination for competency.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shimeka L Currin in court with Attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Shimeka L Currin in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Return of Doctor's Report.  Parties in receipt of report dated 2-11-14 authored by Dr. Robert Rawski.  Defense reports he not been able to review the report with the defendant for reasons set forth on the record.  Defense challenges the "likely to regain" finding of Dr. Rawski.  
  Competency hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Wisconsin Forensic Unit report dated 2-11-14 and authored by Dr. Robert Rawski, received and filed.
Stipulation for Substitution of Attorneys, received and filed.

Defendant Shimeka L Currin in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Shimeka L Currin in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defense moves to dismiss Count 2 for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTS motion and orders Count 2 dismissed.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
